bibl.title: Anacreon and Athens.
bibl.note: Discusses P. Oxy. LIV, 3722 (= M.-P.3 87.01; LDAB 201). - 1. Introduction. - 2. Literary aspects. - 3. Historical and religious context of the new fragment [cf. Hans Bernsdorff, Notes on P.Oxy. 3722 (Commentary on Anacreon), ZPE 178 (2011) pp. 29-31: ""Anacreon invokes Eubuleus, the swineherd""]. - 4. Eubuleus the Swineherd, Eumaeus the Swineherd, and Zeus Eubuleus. - 5. Immediate context of the Eubuleus fragment. - 6. Other fragments of Anacreon dealing with the Demeter myth? - 7. Conclusion.
